description.narrative:
Oxfam Novib in Occupied Palestinian Territory together with five Palestinians Organizations (Palestinian Agricultural Development Association (PARC), Palestinian Medical Relief Society (PMRS), Women#s Centre for Legal Aid and Counselling (WCLAC), Juzoor for Health and Social Development and the Palestinian Counselling Centre (PCC)/ The Jerusalem Coalition, began implementing a three year consortium 3.5 million Euro project entitled #Protect the Rights and Improve Resilience of Vulnerable Communities in East Jerusalem# in June 2012. The European Union Delegation in Jerusalem is funding the project with a 3.1 Million Euros and the remaining amount is co-financed by Oxfam Novib.
The project#s overall objective is to contribute to protecting the rights and improving the resilience ofvulnerable Palestinian communities in East Jerusalem. The objective aims at actively engaging vulnerable communities in East Jerusalem five neighbourhoods to uphold their socio-economic and political rights particularly in Silwan, Sur Bahir, Old City, Wadi Al-Jozand Esawiyyeh. These neighbourhoods are particularly vulnerable to political conflict including settlement activity and violence, and displacement. The specific objective of the action is to #revive Palestinian civilsociety organization#s presence in East Jerusalem and mobilize communities to actively participate in improving their access to and protection of their social, political and economic rights.#
The project targets schools university students, parents, teachers, schools, youth, women vulnerable to poverty and International Humanitarian Law violations, community leaders, legal, social and health professionals, international policy makers, international civil society and media.

participating-org.narrative:
Oxfam Novib has been active in the Occupied Palestinian Territory/Israel (OPT/I) since 1982 and working with Palestinian refugees in Lebanon since the mid 1980s. It has built up a strong network of relationships with local NGOs and counts among its localcounterparts some of the largest and most professional NGOs in various sectors. It has accompanied these NGOs in their development from ad hoc volunteer groups to sizeable professional institutions with national outreach. At the same time the conceptualisation of the programme has evolved from three country programs in the early 1990s to a program for Palestinians in the Middle East (PME) working withPalestinians in OPT, Israel and Lebanon.
The programme has changed over the years with the establishment of the Palestinian Authority (PA) in the mid-1990s from a focus on support and service provision at a grassroots level and grassroots mobilization, to working towards influencing the establishment of the PA, its lawmaking and supporting building a democratic state # this involved supporting efforts of Palestinian civil society to build the basis for a democratic Palestinian state with room for civil participation, ensuring inclusion of vulnerable groups, refugees and women, and shaping its laws and systems. Oxfam Novib has also supported partners that are working on the provision of humanitarian assistance, response preparedness and conflict transformation. We have also supported partners in the provision of health services, access to quality education and gender justice.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to social and political participation
